required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of Three Influenza Vaccines Adults Ages 18 and Older
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Stratified, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, NonInferiority Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of a Cell-based Quadrivalent Subunit Influenza Virus Vaccine and Cell-based Trivalent Subunit Influenza Virus Vaccines in Adults Ages ≥18 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate safety and immunogenicity of three influenza vaccines in adults 18 years of age and above.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: 1.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
primary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of GMT in subjects measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c and TIV2c. Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c or TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5.

primary_outcome.measure: 2. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
primary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc,TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer

secondary_outcome.measure: 3. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to <65 and ≥ 65 Years Age Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against each vaccine strains, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with ether QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer.The CBER criterion for 18 to <65 years age group is that the lower bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody should meet or exceed 40% and that for the ≥ 65 years age group should meet or exceed 30%

secondary_outcome.measure: 4. Percentages of Subjects Achieving HI Titer ≥1:40 After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to <65 and ≥ 65 Years Age-cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing HI titer ≥1:40, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c The CBER criterion for 18 to <65 years age group is that the lower bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving an HI antibody titer ≥ 1:40 should meet or exceed 70% and that for the ≥ 65 years age group should meet or exceed 60%

secondary_outcome.measure: 5.Geometric Mean Ratios (GMR) in Subjects After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to ≤60 Years and ≥ 61 Years Age Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the geometric mean ratio (GMR). The ratio of post-vaccination to pre-vaccination HI GMTs, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is >2.5 and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >2.0

secondary_outcome.measure: 6. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to ≤60 Years and ≥ 61 Years Age Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer The CHMP criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is that the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion or significant increase in HI titer is >40% and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >30%

secondary_outcome.measure: 7. Percentages of Subjects Achieving HI Titer ≥1:40 After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to ≤60 Years and ≥ 61 Years Age Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing HI titer ≥1:40, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c and TIV2c The CHMP criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is that the percentage of subjects achieving an HI titer ≥1:40 is >70% and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >60%

secondary_outcome.measure: 8.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed by GMT in subjects measured by HI assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c. Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the superiority margin of 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: 9.Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against influenza strain B2, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with QIVc or TIV1c Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c - % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody in ≥ 18 years age group does not exceed the margin of 0 points

secondary_outcome.measure: 10.GMT in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV2c Against B1 Strain
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV2c was assessed by GMT in subjects measured by HI assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV2c. Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the superiority margin of 1

secondary_outcome.measure: 11.Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV2c Against B1 Strain
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV2c in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against influenza strain B1, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with QIVc or TIV2c Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV2c - % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody in ≥ 18 years age group does not exceed the margin of 0 points

secondary_outcome.measure: 12.Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic reactions, day 1 to 7 after vaccination with one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)

secondary_outcome.measure: 13.Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs (day 1 to 22 after vaccination), serious adverse events (SAEs), medically attended AEs, AEs leading to withdrawal from the study, new onset of chronic diseases (NOCDs), and concomitant medications (day 1 to day 181 post vaccination) after receiving one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female ages 18 years and older.
2. Individuals who give written informed consent, who can comply with study procedures, and who are available for follow-up.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Individuals recently vaccinated against influenza
2. Subjects with contraindications to receive influenza vaccine
3. Please contact the site for additional eligibility criteria

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled from 40 centers in US
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects were included in the trial

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1,H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1,H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: 1.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of GMT in subjects measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c and TIV2c. Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c or TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on Per Protocol (PP) Population i.e. all subjects in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) efficacy/immunogenicity population correctly receive the vaccine, have no major protocol deviations leading to exclusion as defined prior to unblinding/analysis and are not excluded due to other reasons defined prior to unblinding or analysis

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

measure.title: 1.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
measure.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of GMT in subjects measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c and TIV2c. Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c or TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5.
measure.population: Analysis was done on Per Protocol (PP) Population i.e. all subjects in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) efficacy/immunogenicity population correctly receive the vaccine, have no major protocol deviations leading to exclusion as defined prior to unblinding/analysis and are not excluded due to other reasons defined prior to unblinding or analysis

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c, assessed in terms of ratios of GMT against influenza strain H1N1
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c/GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c, assessed in terms of ratios of GMT against influenza strain H3N2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c/GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c, assessed in terms of ratios of GMT against influenza strain B1
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c/GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV2c, assessed in terms of ratios of GMT against influenza strain B2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV2c/GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the non-inferiority margin of 1.5

outcome.title: 2. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc,TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PP population

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

measure.title: 2. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c
measure.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to comparator TIVc (For H1N1, H3N2 and B1 strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV1c and for B2 i.e. alternate B strain, the comparison is between QIVc and TIV2c) was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc,TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer
measure.population: Analysis was done on PP population

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c in terms of differences in seroconversion rates against influenza strain H1N1
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the margin of 10%

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c in terms of differences in seroconversion rates against influenza strainH3N2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the margin of 10%

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c in terms of differences in seroconversion rates against influenza strain B1
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the margin of 10%

analysis.groups_desc: Non-inferiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV2c in terms of differences in seroconversion rates against influenza strain B2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV2c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the margin of 10%

outcome.title: 3. Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to <65 and ≥ 65 Years Age Cohorts
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against each vaccine strains, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with ether QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer.The CBER criterion for 18 to <65 years age group is that the lower bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody should meet or exceed 40% and that for the ≥ 65 years age group should meet or exceed 30%
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS immunogenicity set i.e. all subjects in the enrolled set who receive the study vaccination and provide immunogenicity data at visit 1 and visit 2

measure.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c Seroconversion is defined in subjects seronegative at baseline (i.e., HI titer <1:10 at Day 1) as post-vaccination HI titer ≥1:40, and defined in subjects sero-positive at baseline (i.e., HI titer ≥1:10 at Day 1) as a minimum of a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer The CHMP criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is that the percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion or significant increase in HI titer is >40% and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >30%
measure.population: Analysis was done on FAS immunogenicity set.

outcome.title: 7. Percentages of Subjects Achieving HI Titer ≥1:40 After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to ≤60 Years and ≥ 61 Years Age Cohorts
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing HI titer ≥1:40, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c and TIV2c The CHMP criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is that the percentage of subjects achieving an HI titer ≥1:40 is >70% and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >60%
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS immunogenicity set.

group.title: QIVc (18 to ≤60 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: QIVc (≥ 61 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (18 to ≤60 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1,H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013- 2014 season

group.title: TIV1c (≥ 61 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1,H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013- 2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (18 to ≤60 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

group.title: TIV2c (≥ 61 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

measure.title: 7. Percentages of Subjects Achieving HI Titer ≥1:40 After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c in 18 to ≤60 Years and ≥ 61 Years Age Cohorts
measure.description: Immunogenicity was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing HI titer ≥1:40, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with either QIVc, TIV1c and TIV2c The CHMP criterion for 18 to ≤60 years age group is that the percentage of subjects achieving an HI titer ≥1:40 is >70% and that for ≥ 61 years age group is >60%
measure.population: Analysis was done on FAS immunogenicity set.

outcome.title: 8.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed by GMT in subjects measured by HI assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c. Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the superiority margin of 1.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS population

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

measure.title: 8.Geometric Mean Titres (GMT) in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
measure.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed by GMT in subjects measured by HI assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV1c. Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the superiority margin of 1.
measure.population: Analysis was done on FAS population

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c in terms of ratios of GMT against influenza strain B2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The upper bound of the 2-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV1c or TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody should not exceed the superiority margin of 1.

outcome.title: 9.Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against influenza strain B2, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with QIVc or TIV1c Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody in ≥ 18 years age group does not exceed the margin of 0 points
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS population

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

measure.title: 9.Percentages of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c Against B2 Strain
measure.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV1c was assessed in terms of percentages of subjects showing seroconversion or significant increase in HI antibody titers, against influenza strain B2, three weeks (day 22) after vaccination with QIVc or TIV1c Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody in ≥ 18 years age group does not exceed the margin of 0 points
measure.population: Analysis was done on FAS population

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority of immune responses of QIVc to TIV1c in terms of seroconversion rates against influenza strain B2
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The upper bound of the 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between seroconversion rates (% seroconversion TIV1c or TIV2c – % seroconversion QIVc) for HI antibody should not exceed the margin of 0 points.

outcome.title: 10.GMT in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV2c Against B1 Strain
outcome.description: Immunogenicity of QIVc to TIV2c was assessed by GMT in subjects measured by HI assay, three weeks after vaccination with one dose of either QIVc or TIV2c. Superiority was established if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% CI for the ratio of GMTs (GMT TIV2c /GMT QIVc) for HI antibody does not exceed the superiority margin of 1
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS population

outcome.title: 12.Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic reactions, day 1 to 7 after vaccination with one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)
outcome.population: Analysis was done on solicited safety data set i.e. all subjects in the exposed set with solicited adverse event data

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

measure.title: 12.Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic reactions, day 1 to 7 after vaccination with one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)
measure.population: Analysis was done on solicited safety data set i.e. all subjects in the exposed set with solicited adverse event data

class.title: Use of analgesics / antipyretics for prophylasis
Use of analgesics / antipyretics for treatment

outcome.title: 13.Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs (day 1 to 22 after vaccination), serious adverse events (SAEs), medically attended AEs, AEs leading to withdrawal from the study, new onset of chronic diseases (NOCDs), and concomitant medications (day 1 to day 181 post vaccination) after receiving one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)
outcome.population: Analysis was done on unsolicited safety data set i.e. all subjects in the exposed set with unsolicited adverse event data

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

measure.title: 13.Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After One Dose of Either QIVc, TIV1c or TIV2c by Overall Age Group
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number (%) of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs (day 1 to 22 after vaccination), serious adverse events (SAEs), medically attended AEs, AEs leading to withdrawal from the study, new onset of chronic diseases (NOCDs), and concomitant medications (day 1 to day 181 post vaccination) after receiving one dose of either four (4) strain inactivated quadrivalent cell based influenza vaccine (QIVc) or trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV1c or TIV2c)
measure.population: Analysis was done on unsolicited safety data set i.e. all subjects in the exposed set with unsolicited adverse event data

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited AEs were collected from day 1to day 7 post vaccination, unsolicited AEs were collected from day 1 to day 22 post vaccination and SAEs were collected from day 1 to day 181
reported_events.desc: All the unsolicited AEs were reported by non-systematic assessment and the solicited AEs were reported by systemic assessment. For SAEs- analysis was done on Unsolicited safety set. For Other Aes-analysis was done on overall safety set.

group.title: QIVc (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived quadrivalent influenza vaccine (QIVc)

group.title: TIV1c (≥ 18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV1c (H1N1, H3N2, B1) recommended for 2013-2014 season

group.title: TIV2c (≥18 Years)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of cell derived trivalent influenza vaccine TIV2c that contains an alternate B strain compared to what is recommended for 2013-2014

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial
